p: Acute Ischemic stroke(AIS) has been reported in approximately 1-3% of patients with COVID-19 [ 39, 77, 84]; this is similar with other CoV infections (SARS-CoV-1 and MERS-CoV). During the current pandemic, 370 patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection out of 37 studies ( Table 3) were reported to suffer from AIS or transient ischemic attack (TIA). Most of these patients had several underlying co-morbidities which made them more susceptible to thromboembolic events. [ 21, 77].
